subject: History
title: The Antikythera Mechanism
description: A quick win: understand The Antikythera Mechanism.

hook.text: A 2,000-year-old device found in a shipwreck contains gears that shouldn't have existed for another 1,400 years.

buildup.text: Divers found the corroded bronze mechanism off Antikythera in 1901. Nobody understood it for decades.

discovery.text: X-ray imaging revealed 30+ interlocking gears that predicted eclipses, tracked planets, and calculated Olympic dates.

twist.text: Nothing this complex appeared again until medieval European clockworkâ€”1,400 years later. A technological dead end.

climax.text: It proves ancient Greeks had far more advanced technology than we assumed. What else have we lost?

punchline.text: The first computer was built 2,000 years ago.

quiz.question: What could the Antikythera Mechanism calculate?
options: Eclipses, planetary positions, and Olympic dates
The exact weight of gold and silver coins
